meta.name: Generate Interactive Quantity Reports from Revit and IFC Projects to HTML

nodes.name: Extract - Read Excel file from disk
Transform - Group by Type Name & sum Volume

assignments.name: final_message
assignments.value: ={{ $node["Transform - Generate HTML Report"].json.message }}. File saved as: {{ $node["Transform - Generate HTML Report"].json.filename }}

parameters.content:
## üî∑ EXTRACT Phase

**E**xtract data from Revit file:
1. Setup file paths
2. Run Revit converter (RVT ‚Üí Excel)
3. Check if conversion succeeded
4. Read Excel file from disk
5. Parse Excel into structured data

## üî∑ TRANSFORM Phase

**T**ransform raw data:
1. Filter ONLY records with 'Category : String' = 'OST_Walls'
2. Clean data: extract ID, Type Name, Volume
3. Group by 'Type Name : String'
4. Sum 'Volume : Double' for each group
5. Calculate statistics per group

## üî∑ LOAD Phase

**L**oad processed data as HTML report:
1. Generate beautiful HTML report with embedded CSS
2. Include summary statistics cards
3. Display grouped data with visual progress bars
4. Save as HTML file for easy viewing
5. Results include:
   - Interactive dashboard design
   - Summary statistics
   - Grouped data by Type Name
   - Visual volume comparisons
   - Professional styling

# ETL with CAD (BIM)  
**Extract. Transform. Load ‚Äî the future of data processing in construction**

ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) is a time-tested and universal approach at the heart of every mature digital infrastructure. When applied to CAD and BIM data, it becomes not just relevant ‚Äî but essential.
ETL is more than just a technical process. It‚Äôs a mindset shift ‚Äî one that takes BIM out of the siloed world of 3D modeling and into the open world of transparent, interoperable, and machine-readable data. It is this paradigm that powers platforms like [DataDrivenConstruction.io](https://datadrivenconstruction.io) and drives the future of digital transformation in the built environment.

‚≠ê **If you find our tools helpful**, please **consider starring our repository** on [GitHub](https://github.com/datadrivenconstruction/cad2data-Revit-IFC-DWG-DGN-pipeline-with-conversion-validation-qto). 

Your support helps us improve and continue developing open solutions for the community!

## ‚¨áÔ∏è Only modify the variables here  
everything else works automatically
